ilo: Demonstrate an ability to evaluate a range of health-related text data sources
Develop and evaluate text analytics pipelines using the Python programming language
Demonstrate competence in the use of standard health-related text analytics libraries and knowledge resources
Demonstrate an ability to appraise ethical issues in health-related text analytics
Develop and evaluate a text analytics pipeline for consumer-generated data using Python
Demonstrate an ability to critically evaluate health text analytics publications
generic_skills: Develop critical thinking and analytical skills

Prerequisites.content: Permission of the coordinator is required prior to enrolling in this subject (some programming experience in Python is required)

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Short essay on ethical issues in health text analytics - Equivalent to approximately 500 words in total
Two individual programming assignments – Equivalent to approximately 2,000 words in total (2x1,000 words). Due in Week 4 & 7.
assessment.hurdle: 50% hurdle – Students are required to obtain at least 50% collectively on the three programming assignments.

assessment.brief: Participation in online discussion – Equivalent to 500 words in total
Independent project (Individual) – Equivalent to 2,000 words. Due at the start of the exam period
assessment.hurdle: 50% hurdle – Students are required to obtain at least 50% on their individual, independent project.

date_times.contact_hours: 36 hours, comprising two 1-hour lectures and one 1-hour tutorial per week
